JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is a Member of ORG and delegate of the political party GPE – ORG ( the “ FAC ” ) . During the parliamentary elections DATE , he was a candidate in one of the electoral districts of PERSON . On DATE , prior to the second ballot round , a flyer was distributed in the applicant ’s electoral district , signed by ORG , chairman of ORG . The flyer read as follows :

“ Dr. PERSON , in his capacity as a member of the PERSON ... in ORG , regularly voted against the interests of the county . Moreover , in the debate concerning the route of the MCARDINAL highway , he did not support the version favourable to the county , with which − aside from the county − he probably harmed his own electoral district the most . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a criminal complaint against ORG with ORG , accusing him of libel . Finding that the impugned act fell within the competence of public prosecution , ORG transferred the case to ORG in DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG ordered the continuation of the criminal proceedings in DATE . On DATE ORG terminated the investigation , finding that there had been no crime committed within the realm of public prosecution . The applicant stated that this decision was only served on him on DATE . He lodged a complaint against this decision which was dismissed by PERSON Regional Public Prosecutor ’s Office on DATE . ORG was of the view that the impugned act had occurred during the electoral campaign and , as a candidate , the applicant could not have been considered a public official . Therefore , the act did not concern a matter of public prosecution . The applicant submitted an application seeking a review of this decision to the Attorney ORG . It dismissed his application on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , acting as a private prosecutor , submitted an indictment against ORG to ORG , accusing the latter of having committed libel against him as a public official during official proceedings .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s indictment . It found that the impugned statement was a value judgment , with regard to which the limits of acceptable criticism were wider for a politician – who must display a greater degree of tolerance . No appeal lay against this decision .
